docs.text:
Welcome to the CVTeque API Documentation


Overview


This documentation describes how to use the API.


The API contains data about Users, Employees, Skills and Experience of the apps. The app is deployed to Heroku at  
https://cvteque.herokuapp.com/
.


It handles resources with routes such as 
GET
, 
POST
, 
PATCH
 or 
DELETE
.


The API is powered by 
Vapor
, a Swift server side framework.


Vapor utils commands




vapor xcode
 - Regenerate the API project and download dependancies.


git push heroku master
 - Deploy the changes which have been commited to the Heroku server.




Project layout


App/
    Controllers/
        UserController          # Routes methods of User.
        EmployeeController  # Routes methods of Employee.
        SkillController         # Routes methods of Skill.
        ExperienceController    # Routes methods of Experience.
    Model/
        User            # Entity of the User.
        Employee    # Entity of the Employee.
        Skill           # Entity of the Skill.
        Experience      # Entity of the Experience.
Run/
    main.swift  # The main Swift file where the Droplet is configurated
docs.title: Home
Welcome to the CVTeque API Documentation

docs.text: This documentation describes how to use the API.  The API contains data about Users, Employees, Skills and Experience of the apps. The app is deployed to Heroku at   https://cvteque.herokuapp.com/ .  It handles resources with routes such as  GET ,  POST ,  PATCH  or  DELETE .  The API is powered by  Vapor , a Swift server side framework.
docs.title: Overview

docs.text: vapor xcode  - Regenerate the API project and download dependancies.  git push heroku master  - Deploy the changes which have been commited to the Heroku server.
docs.title: Vapor utils commands

docs.text:
App/
    Controllers/
        UserController          # Routes methods of User.
        EmployeeController  # Routes methods of Employee.
        SkillController         # Routes methods of Skill.
        ExperienceController    # Routes methods of Experience.
    Model/
        User            # Entity of the User.
        Employee    # Entity of the Employee.
        Skill           # Entity of the Skill.
        Experience      # Entity of the Experience.
Run/
    main.swift  # The main Swift file where the Droplet is configurated
docs.title: Project layout

docs.text:
Users


Details


User is the class that is responsible to manage all the users that are registered in the app, it regroups some generic properties such as identity, e-mail, etc.


Properties








Field


Type


Description










firstName


String


The first name of the user






lastName


String


The last name of the user






compagnyName


String optionnal


The compagny name where is working the user






ldap


String optionnal


The LDAP identifier of the user if exists






email


String


The e-mail address of the user








CRUD Operations


All parameters required by routes of the API need to be passed as JSON format


Read all userscreate-an-experience-for-an-employee


GET


https://cvteque.herokuapp.com/users



Read a specific user


GET


https://cvteque.herokuapp.com/users/:id



EXAMPLE USAGE


https://cvteque.herokuapp.com/users/99



PARAMETERS








Field


Type


Description










id


Int


The user's ID you want to see.








Create a user


POST


https://cvteque.herokuapp.com/users



EXAMPLE OF JSON


{
    "firstName":"Anthony",
    "lastName": "Roani",
    "compagnyName":"Wordline",
    "ldap":"",
    "email":"anthonyroani@gmail.com"
}



Update a user


PATCH


https://cvteque.herokuapp.com/users/:id



EXAMPLE USAGE


https://cvteque.herokuapp.com/users/99



PARAMETERS








Field


Type


Description










id


Int


The user's ID you want to update.








EXAMPLE OF JSON


{
    "firstName":"Anthony",
    "lastName": "Roani",
    "compagnyName":"Genesis groupe",
    "ldap":"",
    "email":"a.roani@genesis-groupe.com"
}



Delete a specific user


DELETE


https://cvteque.herokuapp.com/users/:id



EXAMPLE USAGE


https://cvteque.herokuapp.com/users/99



PARAMETERS








Field


Type


Description










id


Int


The user's ID you want to delete.

docs.text:
Employees


Employee is the entity that is responsible to manage all the 
employees
 associated to a User entity. 


The entity has a 
One to Many
 relationship with Experience as he can have several experiences.


Properties








Field


Type


Description










employeeId


Int


The foreign key ID of the Employee that have the Experience






trigram


String


The trigram of the Employee (
ARI
 for example)






availableDate


String


The date where the Employee complete a mission








CRUD Operations


All parameters required by routes of the API need to be passed as JSON format


Read all employees


Returns the list of all employees and their experiences


GET


https://cvteque.herokuapp.com/employees



RESPONSE EXAMPLE : AN ARRAY OF EMPLOYEES


[
  {
    "experiences": [],
    "trigram": "PMU",
    "availableDate": "03-11-2017"
  },
  {
    "experiences": [],
    "trigram": "ARI",
    "availableDate": "03-11-2017"
  },
  {
    "experiences": [],
    "trigram": "SCH",
    "availableDate": "03-11-2017"
  }
]



Create an Employee


POST


https://cvteque.herokuapp.com/employees



EXAMPLE OF JSON


{
    "trigram":"ARI",
    "availableDate": "12-06-2017"
}



RESPONSE EXAMPLE


{
  "employee": {
    "trigram": "ARI",
    "availableDate": "03-11-2017"
  },
  "success": true
}



Update an employee


PATCH


https://cvteque.herokuapp.com/employees/:id



EXAMPLE USAGE


https://cvteque.herokuapp.com/employees/99



PARAMETERS








Field


Type


Description










id


Int


The employee's ID you want to update.








EXAMPLE OF JSON


Tips
 : The same JSON as Create, just change the values you want.


{
    "trigram":"DLI",
    "availableDate": "18-09-2018"
}



Delete a specific Employee


DELETE


https://cvteque.herokuapp.com/employees/:id



EXAMPLE USAGE


https://cvteque.herokuapp.com/employees/99



PARAMETERS








Field


Type


Description










id


Int


The employee's ID you want to delete.








Relationships


Experiences operations : create, update and delete


Read the existing Experience objects


GET


https://cvteque.herokuapp.com/employees/:id/experiences



EXAMPLE USAGE


https://cvteque.herokuapp.com/employees/99/experiences



PARAMETERS








Field


Type


Description










id


Int


The employee's ID you want to see.








RESPONSE EXAMPLE : AN ARRAY OF EXPERIENCES


{
  "experiences": [
    {
      "endDate": "15-08-2017",
      "desc": "Adolescebat autem obstinatum propositum erga haec et similia multa scrutanda, stimulos admovente regina, quae abrupte mariti fortunas trudebat in exitium praeceps, cum eum potius lenitate feminea ad veritatis humanitatisque viam reducere utilia suadendo deberet, ut in Gordianorum actibus factitasse Maximini truculenti illius imperatoris rettulimus coniugem.",
      "title": "Vapor Developer",
      "compagnyName": "Volvo",
      "startDate": "15-04-2015",
      "employeeId": 1
    },
    {
      "endDate": "15-08-2017",
      "desc": "Adolescebat autem obstinatum propositum erga haec et similia multa scrutanda, stimulos admovente regina, quae abrupte mariti fortunas trudebat in exitium praeceps, cum eum potius lenitate feminea ad veritatis humanitatisque viam reducere utilia suadendo deberet, ut in Gordianorum actibus factitasse Maximini truculenti illius imperatoris rettulimus coniugem.",
      "title": "Vapor Developer",
      "compagnyName": "Volvo",
      "startDate": "15-04-2015",
      "employeeId": 1
    }
  ]
}



Create an experience for an Employee


This endpoint add an Experience for an Employee. 


POST


https://cvteque.herokuapp.com/employees/:id/experiences



EXAMPLE USAGE


https://cvteque.herokuapp.com/employees/99/experiences



PARAMETERS








Field


Type


Description










id


Int


The employee's ID you want to add an experience.








Requirements


It needs a JSON 
Experience
 object passed in the request's body.


EXAMPLE OF JSON


{
    "title":"Vapor Developer",
    "compagnyName":"Volvo",
    "desc":"Adolescebat autem obstinatum propositum...",
    "startDate":"15-04-2015",
    "endDate":"15-08-2017"
}



Update an experience for an Employee


This endpoint updates an existing experience for an Employee.


PATCH


https://cvteque.herokuapp.com/employees/:employee_id/experiences/:experience_id



EXAMPLE USAGE


https://cvteque.herokuapp.com/employees/99/experiences/10



PARAMETERS








Field


Type


Description










employee_id


Int


The employee's ID you want to update the experience.






experience_id


Int


The experience's ID you want to update.








Tips
 : The same JSON as Create an Experience, just change the values you want.


Warning : You have to send all the parameters to update the Experience


EXAMPLE OF JSON


{
    "title":"Vapor Developer",
    "compagnyName":"Volvo",
    "desc":"Adolescebat autem obstinatum propositum...",
    "startDate":"15-04-2015",
    "endDate":"15-08-2017"
}



Delete all the Experiences of an Employee


DELETE


https://cvteque.herokuapp.com/employees/:id/experiences



EXAMPLE USAGE


https://cvteque.herokuapp.com/employees/99/experiences



PARAMETERS








Field


Type


Description










id


Int


The employee's ID you want to delete.

docs.text:
Skills


Details


Skill is the class that is responsible to manage all the skills of the collaborators in the app.


Properties








Field


Type


Description










name


String


The name of the skill






color


String


The hexadecimal string of the color






level


Int


The collaborator's level in the skill








CRUD Operations


All parameters required by routes of the API need to be passed as JSON format


Read all skills


GET


https://cvteque.herokuapp.com/skills



Read a specific skill


GET


https://cvteque.herokuapp.com/skills/:id



EXAMPLE USAGE


https://cvteque.herokuapp.com/skills/99



PARAMETERS








Field


Type


Description










id


Int


The skill's ID you want to see.








Create a skill


POST


https://cvteque.herokuapp.com/skill



EXAMPLE OF JSON


{
    "name":"Swift",
    "color":"#F4F4F4",
    "level":5
}



Update a skill


PATCH


https://cvteque.herokuapp.com/skills/:id



EXAMPLE USAGE


https://cvteque.herokuapp.com/skills/99



PARAMETERS








Field


Type


Description










id


Int


The skills's ID you want to update.








EXAMPLE OF JSON


{
    "name":"C#",
    "color":"#FEB6A5",
    "level":2
}



Delete a specific skill


DELETE


https://cvteque.herokuapp.com/skills/:id



EXAMPLE USAGE


https://cvteque.herokuapp.com/skills/99



PARAMETERS








Field


Type


Description










id


Int


The skills's ID you want to delete.

docs.text:
Experiences


Details


Experience is the entity that is responsible to manage all the experiences associated to an Employee. 


Properties








Field


Type


Description










trigram


String


The trigram of the employee 
(example: 
ARI
)






availableDate


String


The date when the employee ends its mission. 
Format is 
DD-mm-yyyy
.






employeeId


Int


The foreign key associated of the Employee object that have the Experience. 
Format is 
DD-mm-yyyy
.








Available operations


Read all experiences


GET


https://cvteque.herokuapp.com/experiences



Create and update an Experience


An Experience can be created for a particular Employee.


See 
here
 to know how to 
manage
 an Experience for an Employee.
docs.title: Experiences

Format is  DD-mm-yyyy .    employeeId  Int  The foreign key associated of the Employee object that have the Experience.  Format is  DD-mm-yyyy .
